body.p: In reply to your letter of the 11th ult. enclosing extracts of Bishop Williams’ communication to the Govt. respecting Waitangi.

I have to state that I know nothing whatever of the circumstances referred to in the latter paragraph of his Lordship’s comm. as I do not remember that I had any conversation with you at the time about Waitangi.

Respecting the raupo cottage in which you were living after your house was burnt I can only say that it was a well constructed substantial native building, well floored, and the interior was neatly lined with kakaho and altogether the best cottage of the description then in the district.
